vocabulary.definition: in a manner that cannot be managed or restrained
vocabulary.example: Millions of gallons of oil were spilling uncontrollably into the ocean.
The oil spill was assaulting our shores and citizens.

vocabulary.definition: failure to take proper care or to act in a reasonable manner
vocabulary.example: Economic pressures may have resulted in a culture of negligence on the rig.

vocabulary.definition: able to float or rise to the surface of a liquid or gas
vocabulary.example: The Cofferdam became dangerously buoyant as it filled with oil.

vocabulary.definition: incapable of producing any useful result; pointless
vocabulary.example: The attempts at the junk shot proved to be futile in stopping the oil leak.

vocabulary.definition: not able to be repaired; irreversible
vocabulary.example: The Deepwater Horizon spill caused irreputable damage to the ecosystem.
